screenshot.alt: Screenshot of a .shc file in Microsoft Notepad
screenshot.caption: SHC file open in Microsoft Notepad

description: FreeCommander is a Windows File Explorer alternative that allows users to explore, manage, and view files. The program comes with a set of default keyboard shortcuts that allow users to quickly perform common actions, such as comparing, copying, and deleting files.

If a user wants to edit the shortcuts FreeCommander uses, they can do so by selecting Tools → Define keyboard shortcuts ... from the program's menu bar. This opens FreeCommander's Define keyboard shortcuts window. After a user assigns a new shortcut to a function and clicks Assign → OK , FreeCommander creates the FreeCommander.shc file. This file contains a list of all the user's custom FreeCommander shortcuts.
